page.title: 14A DAY IN A FARMER'S LIFE
page.content: AFTERNOON After lunch the dogs jump into the landrover and away we go to view the crops and make sure all the cattle are all right, no fences are broken, and that there is plenty of water for them in the various places where they are grazing between Baybridge and Northbrook. I usually meet various friends en route and pass the time of day with them, discussing the weather, the crops and anything else that has happened locally. I return to the farm at about 4.30 p.m. and we all have a cup of tea. Sometimes I will do a bit of weeding in the garden, or prune the roses, but if I'm weary I sit down and have a little nap. We have our evening meal at about 7.30 p.m. and then chat,read or watch the television until about 10 p.m. when we go to bed.
